headline.print_headline: Common Response After Killings in Oregon: ‘I Want to Have a Gun’
headline.main: Common Response After Killings in Oregon: ‘I Want to Have a Gun’

byline.contributor: Laura M. Holson contributed reporting from San Francisco, and Claire Cain Miller from Portland, Ore.
byline.original: By JACK HEALY and JULIE TURKEWITZ

snippet: While President Obama has called for stricter gun regulations, many in the Roseburg, Ore., community said the shooting rampage had only increased their belief in the importance of owning guns.
abstract: Many Oregon residents have expressed desire to own gun in wake of shooting at Umpqua Community College, rejecting Pres Obama's call for stricter gun laws in favor of safety they believe gun affords; tragedy has prompted others to support gun control, perpetuating debate playing out in United States.
lead_paragraph: While President Obama has called for stricter gun regulations, many in the Roseburg, Ore., community said the shooting rampage had only increased their belief in the importance of owning guns.
